answers.answer: You don't have gestational diabetes? Usually that's why there is sugar in the urine. Watch your sugar and carb intake.

What had you ate that day? It may have been why. If there has been any flag until now then that may be why she isn't concerned. Did you have any symptoms of High sugar? There can be a lot of factors I would worry about it if she isn't. Next apt. If there is a problem with it. I'd be concerned though.

question: So went to the doctors and had my pee checked like usual visits. This time the results came back that I have 250 glucose in urine... I called the doctor as I was concerned and she said she's not very concerned about it. Can't stop thinking about it and wondering if anyone knows if it's really no big deal or if it can be serious? Havent been able to get this off my mind!Thank you
title: sugar in urine
